channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the metal 5 gallon can of primer (NA1993) releasing 2.5 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release. so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report I-2023090137
item.description:
Report I-2023090137

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: Erlanger
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DHL EXPRESS (USA), INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 09/12/2023, during the cargo processing, a package was reported as showing signs of Ieaking inner commodity. Upon further inspection, the inner packaging was broken and released all contained commodity. This incident occurred at the CVG HUB, 236 Wendell H Ford Blvd, Erianger KY 41018. Transportation by air has been confirmed.

item.title: Report X-2023090657
item.description:
Report X-2023090657

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-09
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to a leaking hazmat that a manager found on their dock. QA arrived and put it into a lined tote, spill pads were used to clean up leaked product. DescribePack: Body of bottle was dented causing cap to come loose allowing internal leakage to happen DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened, package was put into a lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023090636
item.description:
Report X-2023090636

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-11
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap was loose, so the product began to leak. We cleaned up the spillage with neutralizer. We sat the package and clean-up materials in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Cap became loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023090633
item.description:
Report X-2023090633

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-09
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Metal pail was found during a dock walk by a QA employee, pail was put into a lined tote and spill pads were used to clean up leaked product DescribePack: Welded part that holds the handle onto the side of the body of the metal pail was somehow damaged during transit cuasing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pail was kept in a lined tote to prevent leakage as best as possible.

item.title: Report E-2023080198
item.description:
Report E-2023080198

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-14T00:31:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: RUSSELL
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7/25/2023, personnel at CSX Russel, KY yard, reported UTLX671478, a loaded tank car of Xylenols, was observed leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and SASOL Chemicals was notified via CHEMTREC (report #2023-07-25-00337). Quick Response, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found (1) of (8) manway cover bolts less than tool tight. The manway bolts were tightened tool tight and the released Xylenols was cleaned from the top of the car. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to SASOL Chemicals representative Randy Shilling (832-783-6428, Randy.Shilling@us.sasol.com). Delay in report submission due to online portal would not accept.
